snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s administration is introducing a bill that would prohibit the use of horse-drawn carriages throughout the city by the middle of 2016.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration is ready to introduce legislation that will phase out horse-drawn carriage industry in Central Park by middle of 2016; bill will offer soon-to-be-unemployed carriage drivers job training classes and a waiver of most fees for licenses to operate green taxicabs, which can make passenger pick-ups outside busiest parts of Manhattan.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s administration is introducing a bill that would prohibit the use of horse-drawn carriages throughout the city by the middle of 2016.

headline.main: Mayor de Blasio Unveiling Bill to Ban Horse-Drawn Carriages
headline.print_headline: De Blasio Unveiling Bill to Ban Horse Carriages
